instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad and keyboard problem
threads.message:
I'm working on a board that came in for trackpad click not working. After doing measurements i found a short to ground on pin 52 (<SIGNAL>PICKB_L</SIGNAL>) of <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>. 

I removed <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, measured the trace, and it had no short to ground.

After booting trackpad click was working again.

After booting a second time now both the trackpad and the keyboard are no longer recognized.

I'm assuming something fried the chip, but i have no idea what. 

Since i currently only have one more spare <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> i'm a bit wary of sticking that one on without further testing, but i have no idea what could have caused the malfunction.

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad and keyboard problem
threads.message: If it was working before could be bad soldering.....

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad and keyboard problem
2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad and keyboard problem
threads.message: It was working for a short time after the soldering, and i'm pretty confident in my soldering. I also think the chip died, but i want to make certain the new one i'm going to put on does not die because i missed something else killing the chip.

threads.title: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad and keyboard problem
threads.message: Use preheater and lower the temp on hot air station........
